capacity-alerts-tooltip: Total number of managed elements with capacity alerts.
dp-alerts-tooltip: Total number of volumes and servers with data protection alerts
jobs-alerts-tooltip: Total number of failed job alerts in the last 24 hours.
hardware-alerts-tooltip: Total number of hardware resources with alerts.
file-used-capacity-tooltip: File Pool Used - Sum of all file pool utilization capacities in the system.
used-capacity-tooltip: Thin Used - Sum of all pool utilization capacities in the system. 0, if the thin volumes do not have any data.
protected-capacity-tooltip: Protected - Sum of capacity of all primary volumes that are protected in the system. 0, if there are no volumes protected.
unprotected-capacity-tooltip: Unprotected - Sum of capacity of all primary volumes that are unprotected in the system.
secondary-capacity-tooltip: Secondary - Sum of capacity of all secondary volumes in the system. 0, if there are no volumes protected.
free-capacity-tooltip: Thin Free - Unused thin capacity in the system i.e, difference between Total pool capacity and Thin Used.
allocated-capacity-tooltip: Allocated to Pools - Sum of capacities of all the pools in the system. 0, if there are no pools.
unallocated-capacity-tooltip: Unallocated to Pools - Unused parity group capacity i.e, difference between total capacity and allocated to pools.
subscription-capacity-tooltip: Subscription % - Subscribed capacity of all pools in the system. 0, if no volumes are created.
protected-tooltip: Protected - Sum of capacity of all Primary Volumes that are protected in the system. 0, if there are no volumes protected.
unprotected-tooltip: Unprotected - Sum of capacity of all Primary Volumes that are unprotected in the system.
secondary-tooltip: Secondary - Sum of capacity of all Secondary Volumes.
overcommit-capacity-tooltip: Overcommit % - Overcommit capacity of all file pools in the system. 0, if no volumes are created.
common-label-physical-capacity: Ph. Cap. alloc for File Pools
physical-capacity-tooltip: Physical Capacity - Sum of capacities of all the block pools in the system. 0, if there are no pools
file-physical-capacity-tooltip: Physical Capacity - Sum of capacities of all the file pools in the system. 0, if there are no file pools
storage-port-enable-security-content: Modify security for the {{getSelectedCount()}} selected ports to:
nav-bar-header-help-tooltip: Click to select and open or close Help
storage-pools-basic: Select capacity from Tiers to allocate to Pool
storage-pools-advance: Select Parity Groups to create Pool
storage-pools-active-flash-license-info: Platinum tier parity group and valid license is needed to enable Active Flash for Pool.

storage-volume-protected-cannot-expand: This volume is protected and can't be expanded
security-delete-current-content: The current account domain will be deleted. Do you want to proceed?
change-local-password-error: Password and Confirm Password do not match.
select-port-wwn-tooltip: Optional inputs - Select the storage port and Server WWN to be used for create one or more path between the Server and Storage system. If not selected, Hitachi Storage Advisor will auto select the best port and WWN to be used
lun-alignment-tooltip: Select Yes if you want the volume to be attached to all servers using same LUN ID
auto-create-zone-tooltip: Select Yes if you want to create zones between the Storage port and Server WWNs
parity-group-delete-current-content: The current parity group will be deleted. Do you want to proceed?
parity-group-add-basic-prompt: Not enough identical disks available to create any parity groups.

storage-system-invalid-username: Enter alphanumeric characters or symbols (- . @ _) within 63 characters. If you have already setup username using other character with HDvM-SN, please modify.
storage-system-invalid-password: Enter alphanumeric characters or symbols (- . @ _) within 63 characters. If you have already setup password using other character with HDvM-SN, please modify.
storage-system-update-invalid-username: Invalid username. Enter alphanumeric characters or symbols (- . @ _) within 63 characters. If you have already setup username using other character with HDvM-SN, please modify.
storage-system-update-invalid-password: Invalid password. Enter alphanumeric characters or symbols (- . @ _) within 63 characters. If you have already setup password using other character with HDvM-SN, please modify.
common-error-message: Check input and try again. Otherwise, navigate to the Jobs page and view job status - the operation may be taking longer than expected.
navigator-session-modal-error: Storage Navigator is not accessible. Please verify network connectivity and credentials used to onboard Storage System.
navigator-session-html-error: Storage Navigator is not accessible. Please close this page and verify network connectivity and credentials used to onboard Storage System.
navigator-session-permission-modal-error: You do not have sufficient permissions to launch Storage Navigator from this page.
navigator-session-permission-html-error: You do not have sufficient permissions to launch this page of Storage Navigator. Please close this page and log on to Hitachi Storage Advisor with a different user who has sufficient permissions.
common-api-get-message: Failed to get data from API. Try again.

volume-actions-resume-unprotected-select: One or more of the selected volumes are not protected. Cannot perform resume operation on these volumes.

volume-actions-restore-unprotected-selec: One or more of the selected volumes are not protected. Cannot perform restore operation on these volumes.

volume-actions-suspend-confirmation-mess: The schedule for selected snapshots and the replication for selected clones will be suspended. Do you want to continue?
host-delete-zero-selected: Select at least one server for deletion!

host-delete-currect-content: The current server will be deleted. Do you want to proceed?
no-data-protected: No data has been protected yet.
clone-now-tooltip: Clone now - Makes a point in time copy of the volume selected using Shadow Image technology
full-copy-tooltip: Full Copy - Makes a continuous copy of the volumes selected using Shadow Image technology
snapshot-tooltip: Snapshot - Schedules snapshots of the volumes selected using Thin Image technology
add-host-tool-tip: Use this to bulk import server information from an excel sheet
invalid-protect-volume-copy-group-messag: Enter up to 26 alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores in the name, but it must not start with a hyphen.
invalid-volume-label: Revise the label input. Following characters are valid: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_', '.', '@', '-' and ' '. The maximum length of label and suffix is 32. The label must not start with '-' or ' ' and must not end with ' '.
file-pool-select-capacity: Select Capacity for New File Pool
file-pool-invalid-label: Enter a label from 1 to 255 alphanumeric characters
file-pool-detail-delete-confirmation: The current File Pool will be deleted. Do you want to proceed?

file-pool-raid-warning: Warning: The current selection does not follow best practices because it includes disks that are not RAID 6. There may be unintended results
file-pool-create-note: must be selected in tiered file pool creation

no-available-replication-group: Selected volume is in an external replication group or not in any HSA replication group(s).
replication-groups-hourly-note: Note: Snapshot will start every {{schedule.hourInterval || hourInterval}} hour(s) on the {{minuteDisplay}} minute of the hour.
replication-groups-hourly-note-zero: Note: Snapshot will start every {{schedule.hourInterval || hourInterval}} hour(s) on the hour.
replication-group-edit-remove-pvol-messa: Select the Primary volume(s) to remove
replication-group-remove-secondary-volum: The volume will be removed from selected Replication Groups and the volume pairs will be deleted.
replication-group-actions-confirmation-m: The following volume pair(s) and other volume pair(s) in same consistency group will be affected. Do you want to continue?
replication-group-actions-suspend-snapsh: The selected replication group will be suspended. No volume pair(s) will be affected. Do you want to continue?
replication-group-actions-resume-snapsho: The selected replication group will be resumed. No volume pair(s) will be affected. Do you want to continue?
replication-group-actions-delete-snapsho: The selected replication group will be deleted. No volume pair(s) will be affected. Do you want to continue?
replication-group-actions-restore-confir: The selected primary volume(s) will be restored by using corresponding secondary volume(s). Do you want to continue?
